name: Delivery & Streaming
description: Optimized for final delivery and streaming platforms

codecs.name: H.264 (AVC)
codecs.description: Most widely supported codec for delivery
codecs.workflowNotes: Best for web streaming, social media, and general distribution. Excellent compatibility across all devices and platforms.

variants.name: Main Profile
variants.description: Standard profile for broadcast and streaming

codecs.name: H.265 (HEVC)
codecs.description: Next-generation codec with superior compression efficiency
codecs.workflowNotes: Better compression than H.264, ideal for 4K/8K streaming. Requires more processing power but delivers smaller file sizes.

codecs.name: VP9
codecs.description: Google's open-source codec for web streaming
codecs.workflowNotes: Used by YouTube and other Google services. Good compression efficiency with royalty-free licensing.

codecs.name: AV1
codecs.description: Latest open-source codec with superior compression
codecs.workflowNotes: Future-proof codec with excellent compression efficiency. Slower encoding but significantly smaller file sizes.

variants.name: High Profile
variants.description: Advanced AV1 profile with enhanced features

variants.name: Professional Profile
variants.description: Professional AV1 profile for high-end applications

name: Professional Intermediate
description: High-quality codecs optimized for professional post-production workflows

codecs.name: Apple ProRes
codecs.description: Industry standard for professional editing and color grading
codecs.workflowNotes: Optimized for editing performance with excellent image quality. Widely supported across professional NLEs and color grading systems.

variants.name: ProRes 422 Proxy
variants.description: Lowest quality for offline editing and proxies

variants.name: ProRes 422 LT
variants.description: Lower quality for basic editing workflows

variants.name: ProRes 4444
variants.description: Highest quality with alpha channel support

codecs.name: Avid DNxHD/HR
codecs.description: Avid's professional codec family optimized for editorial workflows
codecs.workflowNotes: Designed for Avid Media Composer and broadcast workflows. Excellent for collaborative editing environments.

variants.name: DNxHD 36
variants.description: Lowest quality DNxHD for offline editing

variants.name: DNxHD 145
variants.description: Standard quality DNxHD for online editing

variants.name: DNxHR LB
variants.description: Low bandwidth DNxHR for proxy workflows

codecs.name: GoPro CineForm
codecs.description: Wavelet-based intermediate codec for mixed resolution workflows
codecs.workflowNotes: Excellent for mixed resolution projects and cross-platform compatibility. Good balance of quality and file size.

variants.name: CineForm Film Scan
variants.description: Highest quality for film scanning applications

name: Camera Acquisition
description: Native camera recording formats from professional cameras

codecs.name: Sony XDCAM
codecs.description: Sony's professional camera format for broadcast applications
codecs.workflowNotes: Widely used in broadcast cameras and professional camcorders. Good balance of quality and workflow efficiency.

codecs.name: Sony XAVC
codecs.description: Sony's modern acquisition format for high-end cameras
codecs.workflowNotes: Used in Sony's professional and cinema cameras. Excellent image quality with efficient compression.

variants.name: XAVC-L
variants.description: Long GOP XAVC for efficient recording

codecs.name: Panasonic AVC-Intra
codecs.description: Panasonic's intraframe codec for professional cameras
codecs.workflowNotes: Used in Panasonic professional cameras. Intraframe compression for easy editing and color grading.

name: RAW & Cinema
description: Unprocessed and cinema-quality formats for maximum image fidelity

codecs.name: ProRes RAW
codecs.description: Apple's RAW format combining RAW flexibility with ProRes efficiency
codecs.workflowNotes: Maintains maximum image quality and color grading flexibility while providing efficient workflows in Final Cut Pro and other NLEs.

codecs.name: Blackmagic RAW
codecs.workflowNotes: Intelligent RAW codec with excellent compression efficiency. Optimized for DaVinci Resolve workflows with real-time playback.

codecs.name: RED R3D
codecs.description: RED Digital Cinema's proprietary RAW format
codecs.workflowNotes: Professional cinema RAW with variable compression ratios. Industry standard for high-end film and commercial production.

codecs.name: Canon Cinema RAW
codecs.description: Canon's cinema RAW format for professional cameras
codecs.workflowNotes: Used in Canon's cinema cameras like the C300, C500, and C700 series. Optimized for Canon's color science and workflows.

variants.name: Cinema RAW Light
variants.description: Compressed RAW format for efficient workflows

variants.name: Cinema RAW ST
variants.description: Standard RAW format for maximum quality

name: Broadcast
description: Traditional broadcast and legacy formats for television and streaming

codecs.name: MPEG-2
codecs.description: Traditional broadcast standard still used in many applications
codecs.workflowNotes: Legacy format widely used in broadcast television, DVD, and satellite transmission. Still relevant for certain broadcast workflows.

codecs.name: JPEG 2000
codecs.description: Wavelet-based codec for high-end broadcast applications
codecs.workflowNotes: Used in high-end broadcast workflows and digital cinema distribution. Excellent image quality with scalable compression.

codecs.name: MXF D-10
codecs.description: SMPTE standard for broadcast and professional video
codecs.workflowNotes: Industry standard format for broadcast and professional video. Based on MPEG-2 compression with 4:2:2 color sampling.

name: Archival & Preservation
description: Codecs optimized for long-term preservation and archival storage

codecs.name: FFV1
codecs.description: Lossless video codec designed for archival purposes
codecs.workflowNotes: Open-source lossless codec ideal for long-term preservation. Mathematically lossless compression with excellent compression efficiency.
